page.title: 14Fishing-Canal,River
page.content: Fishing is a popular leisure activity which takes place on the canal, the river and in flooded gravel pits. The canal is owned by British Waterways and is stocked with coarse fish viz.Tench,Perch,Pike,Roach and Eel. It is a focus for many weekend anglers who take part in competitions along its length.Stretches of the River Wyre are leased to private angling clubs.The Wyre has natural supplies of sea trout and salmon,these are supplemented by the angling clubs who introduce brown trout at Easter and Whit. The flooded gravel pits at Scorton are privately owned and are stocked with rainbow and brown trout.As on the River Wyre fly fishing takes place here.
